intro: Triplaris surinamensis var. benthamiana, commonly known as the Surinam triplaris, is a small evergreen tree native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, dark-brown bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by oval, fleshy fruits that are typically orange to reddish in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
